option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
OpenEncoding: make CanBuildExp extends a function type + testcases + misc
Testcases: apparently, toExpTempl returns different types depending on the specific context, even if the context should be the same Misc: fix comments, drop dead code, and try to make FuncExp arguments *variant

MESSAGE.value:
QueryableTest: experiment with collection definition and start test for IncrementalSet
First, extend existing code: create IncArrayBuffer mixing in all the appropriate traits. Second, try writing a test for IncrementalSet. However, it is not usable at all, since it does not offer a set interface - tons of problem are remarked in testIncremental() as commented out code. To fix this, one should forward all methods to the underlying collection; alternatively, one should make IncrementalSet a mixin. The second solution is better, since we don't want to have wrapper objects with different identities.

Transform the decorator IncrementalSet into a mixin, create IncHashSet mixing in most required ingredients, update test for it in QueryableTest.testIncremental, and fix some stupid bugs
Bugfixes: - IncrementalResult now processes the existing elements of the underlying - ObservableSet avoids sending Include events for already existing elements, or Remove for missing ones
Other TODOs are noted in the test itself
Appropriate CanBuildFrom definitions for Inc* collections in QueryableTest
QueryableTest: start using JUnit
QueryableTest: instead of printing many things that should be the same, print only one, and assert that the others match
BooleanOperators: remove redundant parentheses and semicolons
Misc changes to experiments
Split IncArrayBuffer and IncHashSet into separate files in ivm.collections, without changes
Add TODO
Remove IncrementalSet and the unused BufferObserver, QueryableBuffer, QueryableSet
Mixin IncQueryReifier also in WithFilterMaintainerExp and MapMaintainerExp, as required
Make QueryableTest be recognized as test class (it must not be an object)

Abstract from IncHashSet everything but the specific set implementation to be chosen (i.e. HashSet)
IncHashSet is now defined as class IncHashSet[T] extends HashSet[T] with IncSetLike[T, IncHashSet, HashSet[T]] however the implementation of IncSetLike is a bit hacky (see comments). Abstracting less is still possible, and an alternative implementation is left in.
Misc cleanup
Share code between benchMark and silentBenchMark
Offer hooks for both variants of fix
Misc (unneeded new for case class)
QueryableTest: add some more basic test cases
Remove badly hand-crafted infrastructure
Observable.scala: remove commented out experiments, update some comments

OpenEncoding: try to extend it to full functionality
I modularized the internal content (by splitting it into different traits) and started implementing TraversableExp, analogous to NumExp. Its implementation is definitely more complex and reveals some unexpected problems in comparison - namely, how to ensure that NumExp[T] instead of Exp[T] is deduced as the type of the passed closure. At least, we don't have the problem that T cannot be deduced. This commit also starts solving the given problem by saving into each TraversableExp an instance of CanBuildExp, and having ExpT as a type parameter of TraversableExp. Next, we must use ExpT in signatures and bodies of members of TraversableExp.
OpenEncoding: achieve unification of expression and collection hierarchy, while making type inference work for map (and likely for flatMap and withFilter)

Drop "isLazy" parameter from exec()
Lazy query execution needs to be designed from scratch anyway

OpenEncoding: make CanBuildExp extends a function type + testcases + misc
Testcases: apparently, toExpTempl returns different types depending on the specific context, even if the context should be the same Misc: fix comments, drop dead code, and try to make FuncExp arguments *variant
